reviews.review: Amazing, just know there is more to come
movie had it's awesome moments but misses terribly in others. why have a movie promoting this huge of a cast when only a few get to shine while the others don't even seem as supporting characters.

Amazing movie and with a surprise ending that definitely got me. I left the theatre in total shock and couldn't believe everything I just watched. I believe this is a masterpiece in today's cinematic world.
Blows my mind and breaks my heart at the same time

It is  awesome and shocking. I am sure you will like it if you have been following other Marvel movies, but if not, don't bother. The balance between all the different characters is great and I think it combince comedy, drama and action in a very high level, keeping with the essence of the characters and the story.
My heart dropped on the finger snap.
awesome movie!! yes is not perfect, but keeping in mind how difficult is to squish in all super heroes in one movie, they pulled it out well. a lot of action and emotions, loved it.

Top movie badass villians and the effects are the best iv seen. The sounds effects were amazing the character interactions fun amd all worked well. 10 out of 10 for me i loved it and want to watch it again. What a movie WOW

*** Spoiler Alert***  It started with a bang. Well, a dull thud, at least. Thanos is known for having said he'd rather be hit by anyone other than Hulk. Yet, in the first scene we see Thanos easily man handle Hulk. I half expected Thanos to say, "Puny Hulk" afterward. From there, the story gets better, though not without plot holes, some of which I'll ignore. After all, it's a movie about comic book characters who defy logic and reality. So, what would be the fun if I didn't. We finally get the Thor we should have gotten in Ragnarok. Hulk is absent from the rest of the film, presumably because he's pouting at getting beaten up. And the only Avenger to draw blood from Thanos is... wait for it... Iron Man!?! Scratch that. Thor shows up at the end and draws blood, too. But, it was pointless. We were promised a complete movie. And, when a movie is packed with heroes, you expect to leave feeling good and hopeful. Death's have to have made sense, as in sacrificed for victory. Instead, I left wonder what the point of it all was, and fumed that they basically cut a story in half to make two movies. I doubt I'll see the second one in the theater. I should have learned my lesson after Ragnarok.
